ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Rotations don't makes sense out of the context of lab-based work. Need to revise thinking about how to get students in EMD expose to different disciplines within the field, particularly when non-lab based faculty don't have much experience with short-term research projects.

This rotation with Professor Heimer gave me a chance to see how he interacts with members of his research team, to attend research meetings, and to begin to dig into a dataset on a topic that interests me. Though I have not accomplished much in this rotation, I have truly enjoyed working with Robert and plan to continue to work on my rotation project in the Spring.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Didn't see Chris, but the person I did the rotation with wasn't around much. Mostly did stuff on my own.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Fabulous advisor and mentor.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
